Package com.soen6441.risk_game_u14.order

Class Advance

java.lang.Object
com.soen6441.risk_game_u14.order.Advance
All Implemented Interfaces:
Order
public class Advance extends Object implements Order
The Advance class represents a type of order issued by a player in the game. This order allows a player to attack a territory belonging to another player using a specified number of armies. The attack outcome is determined by a 60% success rate for the attacker and a 70% success rate for the defender. The order format is: "advance sourceCountry targetCountry NumberOfArmies".
Author:
Devansh Akruvala

      Parameters:
      p_Player - The attacking player issuing the order.
      p_SourceCountry - The player's country launching the attack.
      p_TargetCountry - The enemy country being attacked.
      p_NumArmies1 - The number of armies used in the attack.

  • Method Details

    • execute

      public void execute()
      This method, an implementation of the execute method from the Order interface, handles the attack mechanism in the game logic. The specific actions depend on the integer value returned from the isValid method. The different scenarios include:
      1. 1. If both the sourceCountry and targetCountry belong to the same player, the armies simply move from the source to the target country.
      2. 2. If the target country has no defending armies, it's acquired by the attacking player, who deploys the specified attacking armies there.
      3. 3. Otherwise, a standard attack takes place.
      During the attack phase: - Each attacking army is randomly assigned a value between 0 and 6 (representing a maximum 60% chance of winning the attack). - Each defending army is randomly assigned a value between 0 and 7 (representing a maximum 70% chance of surviving the attack).

      The battle unfolds based on the relative strengths of attacking and defending armies: - If the attacking armies outnumber the defending armies, each side matches their best armies one-on-one. - The side with the higher assigned value in a one-on-one battle wins. The victorious armies determine the overall outcome.

      The aftermath is decided based on the number of winning armies: - If the attacking side has more winning armies, they conquer the target country and deploy remaining armies, including those uninvolved in the battle. - If the defender has an equal or greater number of winning armies, they succeed, maintaining remaining defending armies and those unengaged in the fight.

      In the event of a defender's victory, the remaining attacking armies return to their source country.

      Specified by:
      execute in interface Order

    • isValid

      public int isValid()
      This method validates the order and identifies several conditions that render the order invalid:
      1. When the issuing player is currently in negotiations with the owner of the target country.
      2. When the sourceCountry and the targetCountry are identical.
      3. When the sourceCountry and the targetCountry are not neighboring territories.
      4. When the sourceCountry is left with fewer than one army after the order has been executed with a specific number of armies.
      This method returns different integers based on various valid or invalid execution cases:
      1. It returns an integer of 1 when both countries involved in the order belong to the issuing player.
      2. An integer of 2 is returned when the countries belong to different players.
      Returns:
      An integer representing the different scenarios determining the validity of the order's execution.
